title: Kheer (Rice Pudding) Recipe
description: Kheer is a sweet and festive Indian rice pudding dessert made with basmati rice, coconut milk, raisins, cardamom, pistachios, and toasted almonds.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Global Cuisines Asian Indian Desserts Kheer (Rice Pudding) 4.7 (190) 150 Reviews 13 Photos Kheer is a sweet Indian rice pudding flavored with cardamon, pistachios, and dried fruit. This easy recipe makes 4 bowls of this rich and creamy dessert — it's the best rice pudding I've ever had! Submitted by Patrick7 Updated on February 25, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 cups coconut milk 2 cups milk 3 tablespoons white sugar ½ cup basmati rice ¼ cup raisins ½ teaspoon ground cardamom ½ teaspoon rose water (Optional) ¼ cup sliced almonds, toasted ¼ cup chopped pistachio nuts Directions Bring coconut milk, milk, and sugar to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add rice, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until mixture thickens and rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in raisins, cardamom, and rose water; cook for a few more minutes. Ladle into serving bowls and garnish with almonds and pistachios. I Made It Print 290 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Kheer (Rice Pudding) 01 of 13 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 13 Photo by  Arsha 08/12/2019 03 of 13 Photo by  buffyw410 03/14/2014 Made this to bring to friends' Indian themed dinner. Really lovely texture, just the right sweetness, and a divine aroma. Used almost exact recipe except used vanilla sugar (sugar stored with vanilla bean in it), couldn't find rosewater, and had whole cardamom what I steeped in the milk. Took the recommendation of others to simmer for closer to an hour. Served chilled. Garnished with toasted almonds and dusting of Saigon Cinnamon Made 6, 1/2 cup servings. 04 of 13 Photo by  Tricia 05/26/2012 05 of 13 Photo by  andrea92fl 02/26/2011 It's not so sweet like the American version, but still tastes great. I'd recommend cooking the rice longer than 20 minutes. 06 of 13 Photo by  Jessica 04/17/2010 This was good but not exceptional. I only had brown rice, which was a mistake to use because it took almost an hour and a half to cook and it still wasn't cooked all the way. I didn't have cardamom, so I added pods to the milk while it heated up and cooked the rice. Mine ended up being pretty thick because of the long cooking time, but it had a good texture. It was my fault that it didn't turn out great, but it's still 4 stars for the taste. 07 of 13 Photo by  Mariam 11/15/2009 I had to simmer at least 30-40 mins extra for it to thicken a bit. I followed the rest exactly, except for omitting the raisins due to personal preference. My kids loved it! The texture is different from what you get with long grain or arborio rice. Less creamy or fluffy. However, the fact that my kids asked for seconds and thirds means that this recipe deserves a FIVE star in my book! Very easy, thanks for sharing! 08 of 13 Photo by  Asli Ocak 05/11/2009 09 of 13 Photo by  Irene Y 11/03/2008 Don't be put off by the texture of this pudding! Kheer is the original rice pudding, which became part of western cuisine through the British. I like this, but my husband and son didn't (too 'spicy' for them). I didn't have enough coconut milk, so I used more 1% milk than called for. The flavour is nice and somewhat creamy (would have been better and creamier with the proper proportion of coconut milk). I used a little more rose water and cardamom than stated, used sultana raisins, and added a pinch of cinnamon. Other tips: cook the rice as long as it takes for it to become porridge-like in consistency. After refrigerating the leftovers, the kheer thickens up, so you might want to add a bit of milk. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Gajar Ka Halwa (Carrot Halwa) 2 Ratings Thai Sticky Black Rice Pudding 1 Rating Rice Pudding with Saffron and Cardamom 2 Ratings Sweet Sticky Rice with Mangoes 38 Ratings Creamy Coconut Milk Rice Pudding 44 Ratings Halva (Iranian Dessert) Atta (Whole Wheat) Halwa 2 Ratings Dairy-Free Coconut Rice Pudding 5 Ratings Ashure 6 Ratings Walnut Banana Bread Pudding 38 Ratings Kaju Katli Layali Lubnan (Lebanese Nights) 15 Ratings Coconut Tapioca Pudding 58 Ratings Maja Blanca 1 Rating Vegan Butterscotch Pudding Chia Coconut Pudding with Coconut Milk 66 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
